jparsec.math

Class GenericFit

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.math.GenericFit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GenericFit
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class for fitting data to an arbitrary function of 3 independent variables. Implementation based on Jean Meeus's Astronomical Algorithms.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericFit

        public GenericFit(double[] x,
          double[] y,
          java.lang.String f0,
          java.lang.String f1,
          java.lang.String f2)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        x - X values.
        y - Y values.
        f0 - The first function f0(x) from 'y = a f0(x) + b f1(x) + c f2(x)', in Java notation.
        f1 - The second function f1(x) from 'y = a f0(x) + b f1(x) + c f2(x)', in Java notation.
        f2 - The third function f2(x) from 'y = a f0(x) + b f1(x) + c f2(x)', in Java notation. You can use '1' or 'x' for a linear fit or if you don't need it, but must be different from f1 and f0 and cannot be '0' or empty. The only exception (for f2 to be 0 or empty) is to set f1 to '1' or 'x', in a linear fit.

      • GenericFit

        public GenericFit(double[] x,
          double[] y,
          java.lang.String f0)
        Default constructor for only one function.
        Parameters:
        x - X values.
        y - Y values.
        f0 - The function f0(x) from 'y = a f0(x)', in Java notation.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluateFittingFunction

        public double evaluateFittingFunction(double x)
                               throws JPARSECException
        Evaluate fitting function in some point. A fit should previously be done.
        Parameters:
        x - Point to evaluate.
        Returns:
        Result of evaluation. 0.0 if fit is invalid.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getEvaluateObject

        public Evaluation getEvaluateObject()
                             throws JPARSECException
        Returns the adequate object to evaluate the fitted function. A fit should previously be done.
        Returns:
        The object with the function and fitting variables.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getFittingFunctionAsSeries

        public ChartSeriesElement getFittingFunctionAsSeries(int npoints,
                                            boolean xlogScale)
                                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns the fitting function as a series to draw it in a chart.
        Parameters:
        npoints - Number of points in x axis for the series.
        xlogScale - True to sample x axis in log scale.
        Returns:
        The series, with black color and epmty shape. The legend is set to the expression of the function.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • fit

        public double[] fit()
             throws JPARSECException
        Does the fit.
        Returns:
        The set of variables a, b, c. If some of them are not used, its value will be zero.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the number of points is lower than 3.

      • getFunction

        public java.lang.String getFunction()
        Returns the complete function.
        Returns:
        The function.

      • getChart

        public CreateChart getChart(int overSampling)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns a chart showing the input data and the fitted data.
        Parameters:
        overSampling - The number of points in the derived data respect the original number of points. 1 for the same number, 2 for twice, ...
        Returns:
        The chart.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test program.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
